title: How TOON Saves Tokens
intro: TOON (Token-Oriented Object Notation) is a compact format designed specifically for LLM inputs. It reduces token usage by:

features.title: Eliminating redundant structure
features.description: No repeated keys, braces, or brackets for uniform arrays

features.title: Tabular encoding
features.description: Arrays of objects become header + rows (like CSV)

features.title: Minimal quoting
features.description: Strings are unquoted by default, quoted only when necessary

warning.title: Important: Formatted vs Minified JSON
warning.text: Savings depend on your JSON baseline. Real-world API calls use minified JSON (no whitespace). Against minified JSON: uniform arrays save 20-35%, but nested objects and configs can INCREASE token usage by 15-20%. Use the Minify button above to see accurate comparisons.
